get.description: Returns a paginated list of pools

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (1-based)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of pools to return per page. Max 1000

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query used to match pools by name, tokens, or address

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Sort results by one or more fields

Format:
- Time-windowed metrics: `<metric>_<window>:<direction>`
- Non-windowed metrics: `<field>:<direction>`

- `direction`: `asc` or `desc`
- `window` (when applicable): `5m` `30m` `1h` `2h` `4h` `12h` `24h`

Available fields:
- Time-windowed metrics: `volume_*` `fee_*` `fee_tvl_ratio_*` `apr_*`
- Non-windowed metrics: `tvl` `fee_pct` `bin_step` `pool_created_at` `farm_apy`

Default: `volume_24h:desc`

Examples:
- `volume_24h:desc`
- `fee_1h:asc`
- `tvl:desc`

parameters.name: filter_by
parameters.description:
Conditions to filter documents by field values

Format: `<expr> [&& <expr> ...]`

Where each expression is: `<field><op><value>`

Allowed fields:
- Numeric: `tvl` `volume_*` `fee_*` `fee_tvl_ratio_*` `apr_*`
- Boolean: `is_blacklisted`
- Text: `pool_address` `name` `token_x` `token_y`

Operators:
- Numeric: `=` `>` `>=` `<` `<=`
- Boolean: `=true` `=false`
- Text:
  - exact match: `=<value>`
  - multi-value OR: `=[value1|value2|...]`

Notes:
- Multiple expressions are combined using logical **AND** (`&&`)
- Whitespace around operators is ignored

Examples:
- `tvl>1000`
- `is_blacklisted=false && volume_24h>=50000`

dynamic_fee_pct.description: Dynamic fee rate. Which is equal to base fee + variable fee.

fee_tvl_ratio.description: Fee TVL ratio in percentage in different timeframes

has_farm.description: Whether the pool has a farm or not

is_blacklisted.description: Flag to indicate whether the pair is blacklisted

protocol_fees.description: Protocol fee data in different timeframes

reserve_x.description: Address of token X reserve of the liquidity pair

reserve_y.description: Address of token Y reserve of the liquidity pair

reward_mint_x.description: Address of the farming reward X of the liquidity pair

reward_mint_y.description: Address of the farming reward Y of the liquidity pair

token_x.description: Token X of the liquidity pair

token_x_amount.description: Token X amount the liquidity pair hold

token_y.description: Token Y of the liquidity pair

token_y_amount.description: Token Y amount the liquidity pair hold

tvl.description: Total liquidity the liquidity pair holding. Also known as Total Value Locked

get.description: Returns metadata and current state for a single pool

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Base58-encoded pool address

get.description:
Returns OHLCV candles for a single pool over a time range

**Notes**
- If both `start_time` and `end_time` are provided, candles are returned in the range `[start_time, end_time]`
- If only one of `start_time` or `end_time` is provided, the missing bound is inferred using the selected `timeframe`
- If neither is provided, a default range is used based on `timeframe`

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Base58-encoded pool address

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description:
Candle interval

Allowed values `5m` `30m` `1h` `2h` `4h` `12h` `24h`

If omitted, the API uses `24h`

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description:
Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

If omitted, the API uses a default range based on `timeframe`

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description:
Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

If omitted, the API uses "now" as the end

get.description:
Returns historical volume for a pool aggregated into time buckets

**Notes**
- If both `start_time` and `end_time` are provided, the result covers the range `[start_time, end_time]`
- If only one of `start_time` or `end_time` is provided, the missing bound is inferred using the selected `timeframe`
- If neither is provided, a default range is used based on `timeframe`

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Base58-encoded pool address

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description:
Timeframe

Allowed values `5m` `30m` `1h` `2h` `4h` `12h` `24h`

If omitted, the API uses `24h`

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description:
Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

If omitted, the API uses a default range based on `timeframe`

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description:
Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

If omitted, the API uses "now" as the end

get.summary: Get user portfolio with all pools containing closed positions
get.description:
Returns a paginated list of pools where the user has closed positions,
sorted by most recent activity (last_closed_at DESC). The response includes:
- Pool metadata (address, token symbols, icons, fees)
- Aggregated PnL data (deposits, withdrawals, fees, total PnL)
- Per-token breakdowns (X and Y)

For detailed position history within each pool, call the /positions/{pool_address}/pnl endpoint.



# Arguments

* `user` - The wallet address of the user
* `page` - Page number for pagination (default: 1)
* `page_size` - Number of pools per page (default: 120, max: 365)
* `days_back` - Only include pools with positions closed within this many days (default: 90)

# Returns

* `200` - The user's portfolio with pool metadata and aggregated PnL
* `400` - Invalid user address or query parameters

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User's wallet address

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination (minimum: 1, default: 1)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Page size for pagination (default: 20, maximum: 50)

parameters.name: days_back
parameters.description:
Only include pools with positions closed within this many days
Applied only for closed positions
(minimum: 1, maximum: 365, default: 120)

get.summary: Get user portfolio with all pools containing open positions
get.description:
Returns a paginated list of pools where the user has open (active) positions.
The response includes:
- Pool metadata (address, bin step, base fee, token symbols, icons)
- Current balances and unclaimed fees in USD and SOL
- Pool metrics (TVL, 24h volume, fee/TVL ratio)
- List of open position addresses for each pool
- Aggregated total metrics across all pools (balances, unclaimed fees, PnL) in USD and SOL
- SOL price used for conversion (omitted if unavailable)

Results can be sorted by various metrics and support pagination.

# Arguments

* `user` - The wallet address of the user
* `page` - Page number for pagination (default: 1, minimum: 1)
* `page_size` - Number of pools per page (default: 20, maximum: 50)
* `sort_by` - Field to sort by: `current_balances`, `unclaimed_fee`, `pool_tvl`,
  `pool_volume_24h`, or `fee_per_tvl_24h` (default: `current_balances`)
* `sort_direction` - Sort direction: `asc` or `desc` (default: `desc`)

# Returns

* `200` - The user's open portfolio with pool metadata, balances, and total metrics
* `400` - Invalid user address or query parameters

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User's wallet address

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination (minimum: 1, default: 1)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Page size for pagination (default: 20, maximum: 50)

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Sort direction, default is DESC

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Sort by field, default is current_balances

400.description: Invalid user address or query parameters

get.summary: Get total portfolio PnL across all pools
get.description:
Returns the all-time total PnL in USD and percentage change across all user's pools.
This aggregates data from all closed positions across the entire portfolio.

# Arguments

* `user` - The wallet address of the user

# Returns

* `200` - The user's total portfolio PnL
* `400` - Invalid user address or query parameters

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User's wallet address

400.description: Invalid user address or unsupported product type

get.summary: Get the historical events for a position
get.description:
This endpoint returns the historical actions for a position.

# Arguments

* `address` - The address of the position

# Returns

* `200` - The historical actions for the position

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description:
Filter by event type (add, remove, claim_fee, claim_reward).
If not provided, returns all event types.

parameters.name: order_direction
parameters.description:
Order direction for sorting events by block time.
- `asc`: Oldest events first
- `desc`: Most recent events first (default)

get.summary: Get the total claim fees for a position
get.description:
This endpoint returns the total claim fees for a position.

# Arguments

* `address` - The address of the position

# Returns

* `200` - The total claim fees for the position
* `404` - The position was not found

get.summary: Get position PnL data (open and closed positions with on-the-fly calculation)
get.description:
Returns positions for a specific pool and user with calculated PnL values.
Includes SOL-denominated amounts when SOL price is available (omitted otherwise).
Results can be filtered by status (open/closed) and are paginated.

# Arguments

* `pool_address` - The address of the pool
* `user` - The user address
* `status` - Filter by status: "open", "closed", or omit for all (default: all)
* `page` - Page number starting from 1 (default: 1)

# Returns

* `200` - Paginated list of positions with PnL data in USD and SOL

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The user's wallet address

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter positions by status: "open", "closed", or "all" (default: "all")

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination (minimum: 1, default: 1)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Page size for pagination (minimum: 1, maximum: 100, default: 20)

get.description: Returns aggregated protocol-level metrics across all pools
Returns paginated list of closed positions for a given wallet

parameters.name: wallet
parameters.description: Base58-encoded wallet address

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description:
Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

If omitted, the API uses a default range based on end time

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description:
Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

If omitted, the API uses "now" as the end

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of positions to return. Default 10 Max 100

parameters.name: next_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination

parameters.name: pool
parameters.description:
Base58-encoded pool address

Optional filter to filter positions that belong to a specific pool

get.description: Returns all open positions grouped by pool for a given wallet

parameters.name: wallet
parameters.description: Base58-encoded wallet address

parameters.name: pool
parameters.description:
Optional comma-separated list of Base58-encoded pool addresses to filter positions.

- Only positions belonging to the specified pool(s) will be returned.
- Maximum of 50 pool addresses allowed.

Examples:
- Single pool: `pool=8abc...xyz`
- Multiple pools: `pool=8abc...xyz,9def...uvw`
